value.title: 3 ways to REDUCE DATA In Power BI Desktop (No Premium needed!)
value.excerpt: Sometimes you want to reduce data in Power BI Desktop so it's easier to work with. Then work with all the data in the Power BI Service. Patrick shows you 3 ways that can help do this without using Incremental Refresh or needing Power BI Premium!  游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: 3 ways to try Power BI
value.excerpt: Are you wanting to try Power BI, but not sure where to start? I look at some ways you can get up and running with Power BI quickly. value.title: 4 Troubleshooting connectivity tips with the gateway
value.excerpt: This video was based on a call I had last week relating to troubleshooting connectivity to a SQL Server named instance from the Power BI gateway. This is really my thought process for how I handle connection errors to a data source from any application.    LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com

value.title: Copy Conditional Columns in Power Query or Power BI

value.title: Download and Deploy a K12 Power BI Solution for schools

value.title: Download PBIX reports - Minute Monday

value.title: Easily get an access token for the Power BI Embedded Playground

value.title: Enable QUERY FOLDING for native queries in Power Query / Power BI
value.excerpt: We have usually said that if you use a native query, you break query folding in Power Query. Interesting. There may be a way to enable it in Power BI! Patrick shows you how.  Chris Webb Blog: https://blog.crossjoin.co.uk/2021/02/21/query-folding-on-sql-queries-in-power-query-using-value-nativequery-and-enablefoldingtrue/

value.title: Microsoft R, Data Science and Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, we are joined by Buck Woody. Buck is a data scientist at Microsoft. We work together to show how you can easily visualize Microsoft R in Power BI. We use Microsoft R Open and then move onto Power BI Desktop.  The example used in Microsoft R Open is the Anscombe's quartet.   Download sample
